I have tried Will's chat up line myself, but with no joy!Also, i heard that the Dog Track scene, mini Driver actually placed a bet on the dog that won the race in the film, hence a smile on camera that cant not be staged!If you like (simple) but very real films you will love this first film by both Ben & Matt. Another Gus Van Sant masterpiece as well.

I first watched this film on DVD after recognizing the title at the local video store. I was pleasantly moved. it is now one of my favorite movies. as i am sure many others were, i was shocked and initially a little doubtful upon hearing that the screenplay was written by Damon and Affleck, and couldn't help thinking that perhaps the latter's input was the occasional pizza run and neck massage for Matt's writers block. i am not a Ben affleck fan and use his name in the credits as a sign to steer clear but he doesn't manage to cripple the subtle magnificence of this picture. will hunting is a gem of a character, complex and heavily guarded, possessing a unique and superior gift and masking it with an arrogant mistrust in anyone but his four drinking buddies. robin Williams gives what i rate as his best cinematic performance as the only outsider to break through will's defenses and have any influence on his actions, using his own experience and surrendering his own covers to eventually gain wills trust and, in a poignant scene, releases will's true emotions and gives him the confidence to let himself do something with his gift. The effect that will has on every person he meets is relentlessly entertaining, whether it be the Harvard business student, the shrinks (and hypnotist), the other mathematicians, the job interviewers or Skylar. His un-rivaled knowledge and accompanying wit shape some hilarious and impressive scenes. when reading through the comments made about GWH i cant help but laugh while feeling sorry for those people giving one star and advising people to "avoid the hype". there are even a few people complaining about the language used. uuuuum, do you expect a person of will's background and lifestyle to speak in perfect English, avoiding profanities as to please those around him? the essence of the film is the character of will and his struggle to transcend the injustices of his upbringing. have the people making these comments any knowledge of movie history or prestige? the greatest movies made throughout history are those that step outside the boundaries and portray REALITY or a dramatized or sensationalized version of it. thats the beauty of cinema, we see the poignant moments of life portrayed in new and thought provoking ways. i advise anyone complaining over the language used to watch the likes of "a clockwork orange"; "goodfellas" ;or "shindlers list". these are great movies, high up on IMDb's top 250. i am not saying that GWH breaks any new ground in terms of explicit viewing because it doesn't; the language fits appropriately and any attempt to dull it down would ruin the essence of this masterpiece. I wont compare this movie to the heavyweights of cinematic history, because it doesn't need to be, GWH simply is a picture that must be seen, and WILL always be treasured by movie fans, it moves you in a way not many things can in the times we live in. The hype is just. "ordinary people" gave a similar message, but Good Will Hunting delivers it in astounding and unforgettable fashion. this movie is what superlatives were invented for.
Good Story Of A Lad And His Mentor And Then Goes Potential Polishing, Understanding The Real Inner would

Good Will Hunting is not about twist endings, drawn-out action scenes, or even a sappy romance. It has been knocked for being too predictable and trying to hard to pull the heart strings of its audience. . .Both are true.Still, the main reason this may be one of the best movies of the 90's is the deep, moving characters that Gus Van Sant has created. The characters YOU know.Each and every character is someone I know or can relate too. The genius who isn't living up to his potential. The man who has based everything he is on the woman he loved. The people who see the magic in someone, and can't stand to let it go to waste. Even the professor's assistant, the wonder kid whose been knocked of the top rung by a new wonder kid, I can relate to.Let it be known that the movie is going to turn out *exactly* the way you want it to. And let it be known that you'll probably have a tear in your eye before the credits roll. . .I wouldn't have it any other way.

reviews.review_title: A good editor away from being a masterpiece!
reviews.content: I like the way I felt after I finished watching this film. Not in a happy Hollywood ending kind of way, more of a contented put my feet up thing. These days it seems that a film is either transparently contrived as a money making vehicle, pretentiously aimed at being an art piece or just plain bad! It was nice to see an excellent story done in an above average way! My only regret is that a few scenes were not left on the editing room floor. For example why was the "don't masturbate in my moms room scene there". Not because of the subject matter but because A: it wasn't interesting or well done and B: It had no connection with anything else that happened. It could have replaced with another interaction scene between Damon and Driver so that when all the, "I love you's" started flying around I wasn't left scratching my head and thinking, already! You may think I didn't like this flick. Wrong, it was excellent and I give it a nine!

reviews.review_title: Greatest movie to come along in a long time...
reviews.content: I vehemently disagree with anonymous from Vancouver, Canada.  Good Will Hunting truly shines in our lackluster times of modern Hollywood movies. Matt Damon reminds me of Pacino of the 70's.  He is a young and a very talented actor that can hypnotize his audience almost at will.  This movie could not have been successful without the supporting cast of Williams and Affleck.  Driver may not be the "Cameron Diaz" but she is certainly a talented actress.  The scene at the lake with Robin Williams' "uncut" extended performance is just jaw-dropping.  The amount of depth in the character development and the complexities of the plot spun by this movie is just simply amazing and sensational.  This movie is an exclamation point. Good Will Hunting stood out from the crowd without a question.  Overall, I love this movie and would recommend it to everyone.

reviews.review_title: Spectacular cast for a spectacular movie
reviews.content: If asked who Ben Afleck and Matt Damon are most people would probably know that one of them once dated Jennifer Lopez and the other now has a series of successful 'Bourne' action movies. They may also know that both are regular stars or cameos in Kevin Smith movies.What they may not know is that whilst still in their mid-twenties they wrote and produced one of the best 'finding yourself' movies of our generation.Good Will Hunting is the story of Will Hunting (Damon) dredging through life as a standard no-hoper working a labouring day job and janitoring at a top university at nights. Aside from his jobs he regularly lands in trouble and generally burns through life with an attitude, to his best friend (Afleck)'s dismay. What his friend knows is that Will is brilliant, he has the mind of a prodigy.Will could do anything or be anyone he wants but feels most at home without responsibilities, it's the duty of his friends, his girlfriend (Minnie Driver) and a burned out psychologist (played exceptionally by Robin Williams) that have to 'kick him in the ass' so to speak.This film blew me away, and when I discovered later that Matt Damon and Ben Afleck wrote it I garnered an entire new respect for both.

I'm not trying to wax Siskel & Ebert here.  The movie caught my attention during the credits!  It was refreshing to view a movie, that no matter how unrealistic, still pulled at your heartstrings.  Come on, twenty-something is almost as bad as Junior High.  Watching the movie made me think that maybe I wasn't the only one questioning life in general.  If it didn't make you think for just one nano-second, then I'm sorry.  You totally missed something...

That was my first time to see Matt Damon's movie. In spite of his age,his acting was really great! I was so impressed with his acting. And also,the supporting actor,Robin Williams's acting was terrific!I definitely think this movie couldn't get such many awards without him.He is one of the greatest actors in the world.I recommend many people to see this movie.After you see this movie,you can get something warmhearted.

If your part of the younger audience (we'll say that you were born after this film was released) then this is an instant classic for you to watch. To watch a young Matt Damon and Robin Williams with this kind of storyline and dialogue is a absolute treat for us. I was born in 1998 and this is one of my favorite movies that was made before I was born. Highly recommend this classic movie!
Moved by the acting of Robin Williams. Great story.

reviews.review_title: GWH is a classic movie that it will never die.
reviews.content: I don't know who wrote the script or not. Whatever background this movie has I don't really care. What I do care is that what I just seen is a 10 of 10. Everyone involved is great. Acting, Directing, writing, everything. Rest in Peace greatest actor of all time.
This film has my heart. It unveils how broken people can help each other. The personalities are so charming in the film you're bound to love it.
I watched this movie in math class back in Father Henry Carr in 2015 I think? It has "Hey! Do you like apples? Well yeah? How do you like them apples?!" and it has "He stole my line."

The guys deserve great credit for tackling a serious issue with their first screenplay and not merely filling the script with a lot of scatological humour (Though there is some of that here too, it just doesn't seem out of place) All of the characters are well rounded and sympathetic in some way, and you never feel they are there simply out of formula or to further the plot. The development of the story grows organically through the characters. Even Skylar, the love interest (played beautifully by Minnie Driver, as too are the rest of the performances great) is an interesting character in her own right and someone we want to follow through the story. The only measurable difference between her role and that of Matt Damon's is that he has more screen time, but this is understandable, given that he is the title character.In reply to those who say that the repeated profanity use highlights a lack of writing skills, I disagree.

reviews.review_title: I really enjoyed this well-written movie.
reviews.content: I thought that Ben Affleck and Matt Damon did a tremendously good job writing this movie. They both also did a good job acting in it. I also thought that Robin Williams deserved that Academy Award for Best Supporting Actor because he did an excellent job. Someone might wonder, do they really need to swear that much? But they do because Will and his friends are supposed to be living a tough life and you imagine that they would swear a lot. So because they do swear so much, that proves that Ben and Matt are very good writers and in my opinion they should write more scripts in the future, whether it's together or separate, even though they probably would do better together. So over all this movie was one of the best movies I've seen in a long time.

Good Will Hunting is one of the best movies I have ever seen!! Matt Damon is just wonderful! One of his best movies. If you haven't seen this movie, you need to see this movie!! I rate this movie as a 10!!!

reviews.review_title: Smart, funny and touching but not perfect
reviews.content: I've watched this movie about 5 times and I have to say I really love this movie! It's about life and growing up! There are some very touching scenes with clever dialogue and GOOD acting. Robin Williams is perfect as the psychologist and Matt Damon is trustworthy, so is Ben Affleck. Minnie Diver is also acting good and you can truly say that it's something between them, the only bad thing is her laugh! But there are some flaws that makes this film not as perfect as it could have been. The fighting scene are just ridiculous and Casey Affleck is acting a little bit too "dumb". Cole Hauser isn't saying anything at all! Stellan Skarsgård is not convincing as a professor, especially in the scene where he thinks that the answer is wrong but Will says it's right and set the paper on fire. And there is something with his accent.. Anyway, apart from some stupid scenes this is a touching film! The ending is also very good, it's just so genuine! I gave this 8 out of 10.

reviews.review_title: Good to watch, inspiring of sorts, but has loopholes
reviews.content: There have been many stories and cases about someone being mistreated/ abused/ abandoned as child growing up to hate the world, hate everything around him, and being disillusioned. In this movie, the protagonist, Will (Matt Damon), with that kind of past, is a mathematical genius working as a janitor at MIT. A Field's medal winning professor at MIT recognizes his talent and takes it upon himself to nurture and nourish it.There are some serious loopholes in the movie. First, Will, though totally self educated, is shown to be genius at anything he can lay his hands on-- from history, to law, to organic chemistry, to, of course Maths. And all this while fully self educated. Its far more difficult to believe when, in the movie, he is mostly shown hanging around with his no good friends, picking up fist fights, drinking, getting in crimes, etc. I can understand amazing talent, yes, but even for that talent to show off as well it did in his case, the mind needs to be free from all this distractions. I can't help wondering how, he, in spite of all this disturbing things currently going on his life, he manages to do that. This is rather unreal to me.Historically, the geniuses talked about in the movie and compared to Will (Einstein, Ramanujan) both didn't come from broken or abandoned families. Yes, both were geniuses who started of doing something else and were recognized late as geniuses, yes -- but that was because of social or educational systems in which they grew up that didn't recognize or encourage their merit. They could put their minds fully in the scientific or mathematical problems they were working on.There are more clichés -- like the bar scene. I have something similar at "Harvard" bars, yes, but what is shown in the movie is rather exaggerated. Then, when referring to Ramanujan, the Maths Prof signs of the dot on forehead to indicate Indian -- thats a silly and stupid! MIT (and boston area, that has the BHCC too) has always had a lot of Indian maths profs and students, and while that action might have been understandable in the middle of cowboy country where no one may have seen an Indian for real, its difficult to imagine someone who works with so many Indians to give such a stereotypical description.Then, the Maths prof himself, and his apparent inability to understand the effect of Will's past. Most MIT profs I know are more sensible than that. The relations between the faculty and the folks grounds dept (where the latter is seen swearing at the prof after he leaves) is much better here, and there is much much less swearing than is seen in the movie!Wonder what the Bunker Hill CC folks thought of the movie, since in a way, it pits MIT against BHCC.Still, its a good watch, and personally -- I can relate to somethings in the movie!

reviews.review_title: there are not enough words to describe how great this film is
reviews.content: Matt Damon and Ben Affleck are an unbeatable writing team and have created a marvelous film here. It makes you think about your life and how you do the same thing everyday and hope one day that best friend of yours is not gonna answer the door because they finally decided to do something instead of staying in the same spot all your life. I personally am going through that right now. I picked up and moved on a whim January of last year. Thats why i can truly relate to matt damons character and to add to this brilliant movie formula you have robin williams. If you have not seen this movie or are anything like me you will definitely want to pick this up because after one time you will end up watching it over and over and over again as i do. This is definitely a good will movie worth hunting for.

reviews.review_title: Daemon is a genius, Williams is the man who tries to tell him that
reviews.content: Unless you wanna talk about you, who you are! Then I'm fascinated... I'm in! But you don't wanna do that do you? You are terrified what you might see...Daemon is a genius, Williams is the man who tries to tell him that. We see a boy become a man, twice actually. The film is about friendship, love, passion, following your dreams. It is soft yes, it is American indeed, but no film have ever done it like that to me. This film is real, the acting is marvelous, I believe in it, I want to believe that Will is alive, that Sean is a shrink, and that Skylar is devastated in love with this weird man/boy who does not know who he is.I love this film, nothing more to say :-)

reviews.review_title: And it gave us Ben and Matt to boot
reviews.content: I have seen this film 3 times, and find myself liking it more with each viewing. There is a lot going on throughout the story. It is a lot about growing up--a lot about finding the courage to better yourself, and accept who you are without listening to friends you love, but may be better without for a while. The Oscars that year must have been interesting---(is there any tape available for previous Oscar telecasts?). These two unknown children dominating the awards. It's just become a classic movie now. I like the story and the message it gives. I'm not too familiar with film school teachings, but obviously, these two must've done something right. Perhaps, the film school should examine their curriculm, eh?

Well..Much has been said and written about this fabulous movie..but the fact that every single person can relate to the movie is its USP..Not every one can be an achiever in life..or possibly come close to being one..But every one yearns to be a achiever..This movie conveys the message that "Its all in your mind.."..How many of us have scars engraved in our minds..It is up to the individual to get rid of these scars and try to achieve what he/she has set to out to do..This movie coveys this message to the core and that inspires me no end..Hats off to the director Gus Van Sant and Matt Damon & Ben Affleck for writing such an inspiring story..

The film that broke both Damon and Affleck in the big league was definitely one of my favourite films of the 90's.I would return to this film to watch Robin Williams character alone, he is simply outstanding as the shrink trying to get in to Will's (Damon) head, in particular he delivers a speech to Will sitting on a park bench that enchanted and amazed me.I like the idea of clever guys being made into hero's in films for a change rather than the burly action figures we see in the same types of movie year in year out.It is interesting looking back to see the different directions that Affleck and Damon's careers have gone, maybe neither of them will ever beat this moment.

what makes a good movie? is it the headline actors: the big stars? or is it the actors you've never seen before? the actors that you'd like to see more of. that is what Good Will Hunting is chock full of. a bunch of reletively unknown actors. Casey Affleck- to this day he is known and referred to as Ben Affleck's brother. or to my friends he is "the brother on the phone you know the one with the book in American Pie"... in Good Will Hunting, however i see his talent. he is so funny in this movie (not to mention HOTT... lol) as you watch the movie you can see the chemistry he shares with the other guys with Matt and Ben (watch the "double burger" scene for their sibling quarrels...) and Cole Hauser- he is not in the movie as much, just sitting there being quiet buying the beer. but he says one of the funniest lines in the movie (You're legally allowed to drink so we thought the best thing for you was a car)i didn't watch this movie because of hype. i didn't purchase it because Matt Damon is completely HOTT (and for the record i do think that...) i love this movie because it is all about human interaction. without chemistry, it would've been the worst movie ever. but there was a chemistry there that you can feel.if you have yet to watch this movie, i encourage you to rent it at Blockbuster or borrow it from a friend. GWH is worth your $2.99 and 2 1/2 hours. there are no sinking boats or asteroids. and nobody gets killed. this is just raw emotion, a few friends, the f- word 96 times and some beer. you don't have to agree with me, i am not a professional and (in case you want to know) i am a teeny-bopper and legally cannot even watch this movie. but see for yourself the movie that made me cry before i saw it. and the best performance you will ever be able to see by an ensamble cast of reletively unknown actors and Robin Williams. thank you all. have a great day! KD

The double ego of maths genius and waste of space scrapper has been done before, it is a cliché now. However, this film is done well. The comparison between will (matt Damon) and his psychiatrist (robin Williams) is intriguing and nicely put together. Mini Driver plays the girl will wants, who is an intellectual who can merge into a group of lads, as when she tells the oap's 50th anniversary present joke. She also has a mean laugh!!! Will is an interesting character and he portrays the idea that even though you may have a skill, its not worth using it if its going to make you unhappy. You should do what will make you happy in life, as long as it doesn't hurt other people. Id happily watch this film again, its a romantic comedy,tame type of film you have cravings for sometimes.

Goodwill Hunting is a generally well developed moralistic story that focuses specifically on the development of the character Will Hunting. However, I feel that story and characters are sometimes detailed to an unnecessary level and that the movie included scenes that does not aide necessary character or plot development. Without doubt one of hallmarks of the movie is the energetic but, at first, semi-aimless Sean Maguire (Robin Williams). Taking on the role of a widower-psychologist he casts light on Will's life and assumes the position of a wistful father who knows all the answers. He helps guide Will; unlike other characters in the movie (mainly Gerald Lambeau) does not attempt to force a life upon Will.Another interesting aspect of the movie is the conflict. At first, the movie appears to be an example of man v. man (Hunting v. Lambeau) as Lambeau tries to push Will to become what he never could; as the story develops it changes into a man v. himself (Hunting) situation. The man v. himself conflict is eventually revealed when Sean Maguire opens Will's file to pictures of bruising. Continuing, the setting of Boston was one of the best choices made by the directors. It was a prime location as it is home to some of the best universities in the world like Harvard and MIT, both of which were used in the film. It therefore was a good setting because it provided a good backbone for the movie plot of a disadvantaged but bright youth, Will Hunting to be discovered.Acting in the movie was adequate on average only because of Robin Williams; without Mr. Williams, it was rather subpar. The major downfall of the acting being the attempt at accents. Matt Damon, Ben Affleck, and the rest of the gang (despite being from Boston) heavily over accentuate their speech in a way that distracts from the movie. The same can be said for Skylar. The accents do not add to the movie and almost distract from the plot. Aside from the accents, the actors do a perfectly fine job but (again excluding Robin Williams) seem to lack the magical "something" that truly makes the audience fall for a character. Robin Williams, as mentioned, was the exception to all this. His character is exuberant and portrays the role perfectly.While the acting may have not been of the highest quality, the cinematography was excellent. The director's frequent use of extreme-close-ups and close-ups make the viewer feel more emotionally connected to the characters by bringing us physically close to them. Another example of great cinematography is when Will burns his math proof paper and the professor falls to the floor to catch it. The director uses a high-angle shot that shows the professor in a position of vulnerability but Will in a position of power as he is shown above him.Finally, what brought the whole the whole movie together was the music. Just as music in any movie, it was quiet enough not be consciously noticed but loud enough to still be noticed. It added to the overall nostalgia and highlighted the emotions meant to be felt in each scene.The movie has good scenes but they are often lost in the flurry of other scenes. The acting is OK but not otherwise positively noticeable. The camera shooting was excellent as well as the setting. In the end, good directorship and Robin Williams made this a perfectly average movie.

"Good Will Hunting" tells the story of its titular namesake, a truly brilliant young man still struggling to cope with the demons of a dark past. Will's keen intellect, thirst for knowledge, and a tight- knit group of friends serve as his primary bulwarks against his troubles. Yet even these are unable to fully help Will. Will is unwillingly "discovered" by a senior MIT professor after he (easily) solves a complex algebra equation that proves to be the bane of student and faculty alike. Through this Will meets Sean (played by Robin Williams) a professor at a local community college who soon finds himself being one of the few people being able to meaningfully connect with Will. Along the way Will meets a sophisticated Harvard undergrad named Skyler. The two hit it off and begin a relationship, yet Will struggles to connect with her as his deep fear of abandonment prevent him from getting attached to her, let alone anyone, outside his "group." This fear hides within it a heavy reluctance to embrace his God-given gifts and realize his immense potential, and ultimately better his future. The story, the cast, the performances, the character dynamics, oh where do I begin???!!! I could rave about them all, but for fear of being redundant I will refrain from doing so. Go see this movie. It is such a wonderful film.

reviews.review_title: Will Hunting (Matt Damon) has a gift in mathematics
reviews.content: Will Hunting (Matt Damon) has a gift in mathematics; however, he has had struggles growing up as an orphan. He struggles to find a purpose in his life. Hanging around with his friends Chuckie Sullivan (Ben Affleck), Morgan O'Malley (Casey Affleck), and Billy McBride (Cole Hauser) and going to clubs after work are the norm for Will and his pals. Professor Gerald Lambeau (Stellan Skarsguard) works at the local university where Will is employed as a custodian. Professor Lambeau gets a sense of Will's gift when a question he has posted on a board outside of his classroom mysteriously becomes solved by someone outside of his class. Will, is in fact the one that has been providing the solutions. After a run-in with the law, Professor Lambeau, wants to give Will a chance to use his skills. Professor Lambeau, being a mathematician himself, takes on the responsibility of Will and posts bail for him. The only conditions for Will are to assist Professor Lambeau in the math area and Will must meet with a psychiatrist on a weekly basis. The psychiatrist, Sean Maguire (Robin Williams), takes on the task of counseling Will when no other counselors could seem to accomplish the task.Will meets with Sean Maguire and demonstrates his intelligence by testing the doctor of his thinking. Matt Damon displays excellent acting skills, along with Robin Williams when they meet in their sessions. Their sessions evolve into a great friendship of trust and love. Will was abused by his foster father and relates to Dr. Maguire as he was also abused by his father.Professor Lambeau's main goal with Will is to find him employment where he may use his amazing mathematic skills. He wants Will to have what he could not have because his mathematic skills are not so amazing. Will makes fun of the Professor's attempts throughout the movie in setting up various employment opportunities. The Professor and Dr. Maguire have words because Dr. Maguire feels that Professor Lambeau is trying to decide Will's life for him.Will also meets a girl, Skylar (Minnie Driver), who he falls in love with, but given his past he has a hard time remaining in the relationship because he is afraid to be committed to someone.This movie is very well written and directed. It has humor, love, and friendship all combined into one. The music is fitting and the scene angles vary from subjective to objective. There is closeness exhibited in the scene where Dr. Maguire and Will meet for the first time. The scene is very intense. There is also use of a high-angle shot during the intimate scene with Will and his girlfriend, Skylar. A viewer must watch the film to see if Will finds his purpose in life—will he go after the girl? Will he pursue the employment that Professor Lambaugh sets up for him? Or will he continue his everyday usual events of hanging out with his pals?

reviews.review_title: don't be afraid to live and love
reviews.content: What I like about this movie is that it's very kind. It makes you believe in good people and good things.Will was a very gifted boy with a difficult childhood, who trusted nobody but his 3 best friends. They were his family, he would never leave them. Neither for a good and well-paid job, nor for the girl he loved.He didn't believe in this traditional values, like making a career or starting a family. He knew too well that people betray and can turn their back on you when you least expect. He had his life and wasn't gonna change anything.But then he was noticed by Prof. Lambeau who for some reason decided to help this very smart but rebellious boy. With his help Will met Dr. Maguire who not only was able to win Will's trust but also managed to encourage him to change something and try new things.«Some people can never believe in themselves, until someone believes in them»I like their conversation in the park, where Sean Maguire said that Will knew nothing about life. All his knowledge was too theoretical, borrowed from books, not from his life experience. He was afraid to open his heart to new people or new things. Eventually he found some peace as well as also Dr. Maguire who had been hiding from real life since the death of his wife.I liked Skylar, how open she was when she was talking about her feelings to Will, how honest and understanding she sounded. But still, I believe that the only reason why Will dared to change his life, was because his best friend Chuckie told him to do that. He kinda gave him permission. You should really care about someone to let the person go for his own good.I love the film, I love the performance. I never got the feeling it was some acting, they all were so real and genuine. Interesting plot, great acting, happy ending. It totally deserves THE 2 Oscars it got.

reviews.review_title: A Powerful Story with an Uplifting Message
reviews.content: I can't stress enough how much this film means to me. Since my youth, I was always quite taken with Boston – Cambridge in particular. As a portrait of the academic culture's conflict with the working class culture, it can't be stressed enough that though there is something of a fairy tale quality to this, it captures the grit-teeth of the Boston working class quite convincingly. The story of the evolving relationship between Will (Damon) and Dr. Sean Maguire (Williams) is fraught with difficulty, but offers an honest reflection of the sobering power of friendship in the face of self-defeat brought on by child abuse. I think always in particular of this moment where Maguire speaks to Will and gives him the advice – that it's not his fault. We must remember this, through all our own traumas and abuses.

reviews.review_title: Good Will Hunting is a Myth with mythical beliefs about intelligence!
reviews.content: While this is actually a good movie, the fallacies that it promotes outweigh it entertainment value. People are not born to greatness. Greatness comes from hard work, studying and practice. Anyone who thinks otherwise is a fool. Anyone who tells you otherwise is trying to con you out of something. Don't let anyone tell you that you don't have what it takes! Marva Collins sent average, problem, and by some measures hopeless students to the best schools! Demand good teachers! Forget this Hollywood propaganda! You can be great! Matt Damon and his prettyboy friends need you to swallow this hocum. Get to work! Study! Practice! You can be all that you dream!

This movie actually surprised me. I was expecting a boring movie about math. But then i watched it and I have watched it at least 70 times since then, maybe more. Anyways if you haven't watched this movie then i recommend it to anyone who loves moving movies. 10 out of 10 easy. I personally love Matt Damon as an actor and he truly gives one of the best performances of his career. And if u love movies then I would like to recommend another movie, A Beautiful Mind. It stars Russel Crowe and he is absolutely amazing in the movie. All in all, Good Will Hunting is definitely a must see movie and is one of my favorites of all time. Thanks for reading. Hope u enjoy the movie of u watch it....

They sure don't make movies like this anymore. Not that they ever could. We'll never replace Robin. We'll never have 20's Damon back. This movie made careers. Even to some extent, Robin's career was greatly impacted by this movie - by the depth of character in which it is explored.

When you watch Good Will Hunting, you have to look past the Oscars and other awards it's gotten. Because beneath all that, it's a beautiful movie, with a beautiful script written by two talented young men and acted out by equally talented actors such as Robin Williams, Matt Damon and Ben Affleck.One of the most enjoyable parts of the movie was the psychological aspect. We have a typical 21 year old, going out and drinking with his friends, getting in fights etc., but underneath all that there's so much more to him. This movie tells us that we shouldn't look at the surface alone, there is so much more to people.The acting in this movie was incredible, Matt Damon played the role of Will Hunting without fault, he displayed the emotions, the cockiness, he displayed how Will was closed off due to his childhood trauma and he displayed how Will shrouded his weakness with smart talk and intellect. Robin Williams played the therapist Sean Maguire, a man who has seen life unlike the life his fellow academics have, on the battlefield in Vietnam. He recently lost his wife, who he regarded as his soulmate and best friend.Matt Damon plays Will Hunting, who is a brilliant young man who denies his out of this world genius. Will has had a very abusive childhood which hurt him mentally to a point where he can no longer let anyone close to him aside from his best friend who is played by Ben Affleck. That is until a professor at one of the top colleges finds Will's talent and helps him out of trouble with the law. Robin Williams later comes in as a therapist to Will, he is the only one who can really stand up to Will's intellect and manages to break the layer of distrust that Will has developed over years of solitude, and the two develop a bond beyond friendship. Yes there is a girl in the movie, but there isn't much focus on that aspect.The fact that most of the people keep on talking about the probability of someone being as smart as Will tells us that this is a story, that this isn't real. Even so it relates to almost everyone who has been at Will's age. They have dealt with insecurities, fear of not being accepted, etc.Overall, I think it's a beautiful movie, with a beautiful message and amazing effort from everyone in the cast and crew. Especially from Matt Damon and Ben Affleck, who co-wrote the script for this movie. It is definitely a must watch.

reviews.review_title: Surprises on every corner, and astonishingly moving!
reviews.content: This film is pretty damn moving. That's the best way I can figure out how to explain this movie. "Good Will Hunting", directed by Gus Van Sant, is about a young janitor named Will Hunting, played by Matt Damon, who ends up being a genius, and solves a very difficult math problem, which grabs the attention of a math professor, but Will has some pretty bad physiological issues leading him to be seen by a psychologist, played by the remarkable Robin Williams. If you have not watched this film, do not continue reading! (Unless you want this film to be spoiled for you) Trust me, you won't regret watching this. "Good Will Hunting" really surprised me. I was not expecting this to be such a moving film filled with some great performances. There is so much right in this film, but the first thing that really shines in my opinion is the score and soundtrack. Elliott Smith wrote many songs that are in this movie, and he happens to be my favorite musician. Miss Misery is the PERFECT theme for this film. The last scene in this movie is both extremely heart warming and unexpected. Miss Misery really turns this scene into a masterpiece. I am going to have to talk about the last scene, so if you haven't seen the movie, please go watch it, you will not regret it, trust me. The last scene shows Will gone, and his friend ends up going to his house and Will isn't there. This was super clever, because not even a few scenes back, his friend does say that one day he wishes he could just come knocking at his door, and he won't be there because he wanted to move on to bigger and better things. That's not all though. What really caught me off guard is how the film goes full circle, Robin Williams sees a note from Will, and it says exactly what Robin said in the past "I went to go see about a girl", and I started BALLING! The approach to making this film go full circle is amazing. It is just so unexpected, and really shows Will character ark shine, it's just all the right ways not to make a cliché full circle ending, and Miss Misery is playing and it just elevates it EVEN MORE! I really think getting Elliott Smith to write a song for this film was amazingly clever. There was 2 scenes that I thought they should have switched the songs for, because the tone of the song and scene don't fit at all. It's when "Angeles" plays in a very serious and sad scene, and "Angeles" does not have a dark tone, it has more of a uplifting, but slightly haunting sound. They should have swapped that with the scene that plays Elliott's most famous song, "Between The Bars", which is a pretty damn dark song. If Gus would have just switched those songs, it would have made the scene it home WAY harder, it did take me out the scene, because I was confused by that decision. Moving on, the plot is pretty simple, and it's not anything extremely unique, but the approach is, and the passing is perfect. I was not wanting to miss one scene in this movie, because it really grabbed all of my attention. I was not looking at the time, and I really was emotionally invested into Will Hunting. They did not make Will out to be the socially awkward and unattractive nerd that you would expect. Will is actually an asshole, but his personality is called for due to his past. I want to talk about my favorite part of this film, which is the performances. There was no one weak actor here, but Matt Damon's and Robin Williams performances are astoundingly powerful, which really gave everyone a run for there money. The most heart crushing scene in this film is really due to the way the performances were executed, and this is the scene where Will finally reveals what happened to him that has made him so damaged, and it's just so amazingly believable on both sides. I do believe Robin Williams gave his best performance ever in this film on this scene, and likewise for Matt Damon. I was crying like a child, and I never get so emotionally involved in a film, but this movie made me start looking at film as a actual art, I mean come on. If you seen this movie, you will most likely agree with me, because every time I have watched this film with someone else, the other person ends up crying because of this emotional scene. This is THE WAY you make a moving scene, I mean it's just so, dare I say epi-- I can't do it, It would be insulting to this film. I do have to say one thing I think this film is lacking, which is good cinematography. None of the scenes really show beautiful shots or unique angles, they are just pretty lack luster and average, which is a shame because I know Gus Van Sant could do some amazing shots. The reason I say this is because one of my all time favorite films, My Own Private Idaho, has some of the most amazing cinematography I have ever scene in film. I am not saying that My Own Private Idaho's cinematography is anything like "2001: A Space Odyssey" (directed and written by the one and only Stanley Kubrick, and Arthur C. Clarke), but I know Gus can pull of some amazing shots. That is basically my only complaint about this film. If you want to watch a entertaining, moving and interesting drama, you should really consider giving "Good Will Hunting" a chance.

reviews.review_title: Just watched this again after 20 years, still a masterpiece and how amazing to see Robbin William in what to me is the best performance of the movie.
reviews.content: Just watched this again after 20 years, still a masterpiece and how amazing to see Robbin William in what to me is the best performance of the movie. It juxtaposes the repetitiveness and simplicity of blue collar life with the pompous, self important life of academia. Will Hunting's character is complex and its dark scars only break open in the final scenes. Still great to think that Damon and Affleck wrote this in their late 20s. Top 10 movie for me easily.

At first glance, Good Will Hunting in its title alone does not lure anyone into grabbing this DVD off the Blockbuster shelf. But once rented, the pleasure was all mine. Filled with the humor of Ben Affleck, intensity of Robin Williams and mystery of Matt Damon the nine out of ten stars basically rolls right off my tongue. Picture the drama of a tear filled chick-flick combined with the raw brash fight scenes of a Bruce Willis action thriller all while kicking back with microwave popcorn and can of cokepriceless, minus the popcorn and coke! This movie is Affleck and Damon's break out moment. The movie, set in the gritty streets of South Boston, finds its irony in Matt Damon's character, Will Hunting, an unusual 21 year- old math prodigy holding a job as a janitor at the prestigious MIT. Although a bit far-fetched, the cast is perfection in leaving one to wonder why no one dreams to be a janitor. Why can't that be fulfilling enough?Moving on to junior mints, everyone will relate to the simple story line. Ben Affleck's chain smoking, beer drinking character Chuckie, tries to persuade Will toward a better life. Of course, don't we all have a friend like that? Will has a way off the streets that have hurt him, but loyalty is hard to leave. When Will's abusive past continues to haunt his future, enters Sean (Robin Williams) as his new therapist. From here on in the battle is waged whether Will's life of work and bar brawls with friends is the happy ending of his story. Ah, a breath of fresh air and a far cry from our open era of self-induced reality stardom and athletic phenoms, finding success only in the money they spend. It brings to life what makes any of us tick. What keeps us from staying safely where we are and what pushes us to dream?Renting now is a no brainer since these names today would fill theater seats on star power alonedo take into account no one had heard of Affleck or Damon when it hit the big screen. Robin Williams surprises straying from his in your face stand-up comedy to play a therapist who maybe hasn't quite reached his potential. And expect him to have to take a long hard look at his own life. Insert dramatic music and play in slow motion-not that sappy.My infatuation with the movie stops short as I take one star from my count due to the made for Hollywood ending. The film is inspirational, witty and smartuntil the ending. I understand that the grand finale sells tickets and the audience appreciates certain outcomes but no need to dumb down what is central to the story as reality begs for loose ends or bad choices or death or something. No one's life is neat and tidy and Will Hunting along with the rest of the cast could conceivably be in rehab for a very long time. I was not ready to say The End and think happily ever after. Good Will Huntingsurprisingly not about hunting at all. I hesitate to push people to see a film held in such high regards, but it carries itself with a simple charm that allows a deep story to be told. The acting is top notch with the characters believable. Fix the ending and we can run down the beach with Bo Derek in the pursuit of that perfect 10!

reviews.review_title: Understanding all that the director would like the...
reviews.content: Understanding all that the director would like the public to swallow, this movie is vulgar and preaches a lack of responsibility --"it's not my fault- -I am a victim, therefore I can do and say as I please".

reviews.review_title: Good Will Hunting is a dream movie for all!!
reviews.content: I have watched this movie possibly 30 times. Whenever it is on cable I will sit and watch and even finish the lines for some of the characters. I know I am probably bias because of the career path I have chosen (that being a therapist), but this is one of the best movies ever put out in all aspects. Ben Affleck and Matt Damon make their screen writing debut as well as play the lead roles. Damon is so believable as "Will Hunting" that you can't help to feel as though you know him. Another star of this film is Robin Williams who plays "Sean McGuire" the battle scarred therapist that is willing to do anything to help Will find his way through life.In this film, Will Hunting is a genius who has been dealt the worse hand ever, and he tries to forget his past, when a professor at MIT decides to help him and give him a fighting chance. Ben Affleck who plays Will's best friend "Chuckie" who is just like family to Will and wants nothing more than to see him succeed. The movie is shot on location in South Boston and you are able to see all the grit and grime of this area as well as the "better side of town" when Will meets a girl from Harvard. The girl he meets "Skylar" played by Minnie Driver becomes a climactic character in the story. The soundtrack is amazing with one of the best being the 70's hit "Afternoon Delight". It sets the mood in all scenes and is able to show you all different perspectives.I would recommend this movie to anyone. It does have some adult situations but I had no problem watching this with my teenage daughter. It is a film that makes you really think about what is important and to live out your dreams. I know I will watch it again and again.

GWH, is one of the films of the 90's, thats responsible for what you could call 'new dialogue movies', I think. the movie is one of the best I've seen in that 'new' genre. Dialogue is real, natural and powerful. The other great thing about the movie is the camerawork, nice, clean, nothing fancy, the way every movie should be, but only so few movies can afford to be. Its the first movie I rated 10, not because its perfect, but mainly because its as close to perfect as any movie will get.

Fabulous movie. Williams plays the role perfect. Damon is the perfect actor for his role, and matches Williams perfect. Nice to see a good movie, with all that is needed. A must see movie, which I sure am going to watch many times.

I came into Good Will Hunting expecting a great movie. What I saw wasn't great, however it was still pretty good. I give the movie a 7.5/10, mainly due to some of the smart dialogue, and the strong performance from Robin Williams. Other than that the rest of the actors weren't that special. Matt Damon and Minnie Driver are not especially convincing, and I did not see much chemistry between the two. I hope Matt Damon's performance in Rounders is better. I think he was the only bad thing in Saving Private Ryan. Overall none of the actors are bad and the story is interesting, so you should definitely check out this movie if you haven't already.

I really love this movie. The script was wonderfully written. It combines with lots of literary elements, such as a person's quest of self, pair contrast, etc. The genius, the math professor and the shrink establish a well-constructed triangular attachment and conflict. And the three actors, especially Robin Williams, are all excellent indeed. But near the end, this gifted kid seems to change himself too fast. A bit inconvincible But still it's a touching movie, dealing with value judgment, friendship, and "carpe diem". For those who haven't seen this, go see it!

reviews.review_title: Great script, acting, but diminished by "Hollywood Style"
reviews.content: GOOD WILL HUNTING is a very good movie.  The writing, credited to Mssrs. Afleck and Damon, is among the best I can remember in a recent American film. Mr Afleck appears to have benefited from the script of CHASING AMY or vice-versa. Robin Williams' role as the burned out shrink ties everything together to make this a memorable story.  I wish he would do more of this type of material and less clowning.However, the credible story, realistic characters, and excellent script beautifully played by the cast are restrained by a glossy presentation. Anyone familiar with the coastal Northeast (story takes place in Boston) knows overcast skies, wind, rain.  The relentless sunshine bathes the story in a California like light but with gritty old Boston as the backdrop. Doesn't work.Nitpicking?  Probably, but this film is very close to being as good as movies get and every little misstep becomes magnified as a result.

From start to end this movie makes you want to know more about the characters. The way it develops is such a good job from the director and production team. Also the actors pretty much seem like they are on their natural state and that makes you just dive in and want to connect with them. 
Easy to watch and hard to forget because you will never find and other movie like it,
Feel like I wasted 2 hours on this. I would not recommend to watch it

Some people (like Anonymous from Vancouver, Canada) may say it's not that good, but you can only say it if you're under anonymity, really. Matt Damon and Ben Affleck did an amazing job with the script. It's catching, it's bright and it's got a life of its own. The character "Will Hunting" is sooo complex! If you watch the movie 100 times you'll find 100 people who could relate to this guy. It's unbelievable! The first person will probably be yourself (it happened to me), but later you'll find your best friend, your worst enemy, your mother. Don't take my word for it! Watch it 100 times and see for yourself! It's worth it.

reviews.review_title: Great Characterization, needs a little more.....
reviews.content: Perhaps many people have placed too much emphasis on this movie.  I am not saying this in a derogatory way.  The characterization in this movie is brilliant.  Matt Damon and Robin Williams give outstanding performances, although they do become a little predictable by the time that the movie is over.  Perhaps this movie is just that: a characterization.  The plot allows us to look at a man that is intelligent; far more intelligent than the average MIT student (as supposedly proved in the theorem-solving part of the movie).  Like an action movie star, the main character allows us to look at someone that is unlike us.  This goes for the character that Williams plays. We look at a psychologist with a type of awe: perhaps they see an insight into the human psyche that no one can (supposedly).  The problem is that: the movie is full of characterization.  Even though there are a few people that Damon plays running around the streets, we look into his life, and are forced to like him.  Going out on a limb, I am saying that this movie is like a Steinbeck book: the characterization is superb, but the other elements are lacking.  Don't let this movie escape you though, it is worth seeing the characterization alone.  By the time the movie is over, you will feel that you know the people intimately.  That is the reason that I give this movie a 6.8 out of 10

Good Will Hunting is exactly what I've been waiting for. A nice intelligent movie that is dramatic yet funny. I think that this movie shows the wonderful talent of Matt Damon and Ben Affleck not only as actors but as writers. I'm sure it will be a favorite movie for years to come. I would even go as far as to say that one day, many years from now, it will be considered a great classic.

Good Will Hunting really should have been a play. This is not to say that it wasn´t a good movie, because it still does move very well and the cinematography was excellent.  However, the real joy of the movie is not so much in the visual effects, as in, for example, Saving Private Ryan, but in the dialogue.

reviews.review_title: Wicked good movie for all to enjoy
reviews.content:
Good Will Hunting is a timeless classic, that won countless awards, including an Oscar, a Golden Globe and multiple nominees. This movie relays on the acting and bad boy personality of Matt Damon. Throughout the movie the audience follows the life and what his actions do to others. While this movie was released in the 90's, I still enjoyed and understood the film. The themes and underlying messages also still transfer over to today's day and age. I was thoroughly surprised by how much I enjoyed this movie. The film captured my attention as I felt many different real emotions, because of the angles/shots, soundtrack and script.
In the opening scene you get a look at how rickety Will's (Matt Damon) life is in the south side of Boston. Along with this you get aerial views and pan shots of Boston to set the scene. I enjoyed the setting because it showed the rich high life society of Cambridge but also the desolate housing and college pubs.
With having it set at MIT is a bit of a cliche, in the sense that of course Will should belong at MIT because of his intelligence. A positive to being set at MIT is that the writers were able to compare Will to the smartest students and professors in the nation.
One of my favorite scenes was the one in which Will met Skylar (Minnie Driver). Will showed off his wicked smarts, and by the end of the night he got her phone number. Matt Damon has a comedic line about apples. By adding this joke I believe it helps to captivate the audience before the movie shifts to being more serious.
Skylar's has some personality quirks. She always seems give the excuse that she needs to study and work hard, on the other hand Matt Damon has the natural talent to read something and memorize it. She believes in Matt and wants him to succeed in life and have a chance. Everyone but Will believes in his potential. With his rough childhood background he has never been rewarded of his accomplishments.
Will has many struggles in his life and doesn't know how to balance his math intelligence with his social life. As a result Will seems to get in trouble continuously but has become a manipulating and is able to get him out of many situations. But on the judges last straw he sends Will to jail, and the only reason he got out was because of the MIT professor. One of the conditions that Will has to agree to though is to go to therapy. After the Professor sends Will to therapy will opens up about his past and his trust issues.
One important theme that I took away from Good Will Hunting was that child abuse and a rough childhood can lead to trust issues. Much like Will's childhood with abuse and multiple homes, Matilda (Mara Wilson) grew up with child abuse and until she was finally able to trust her teacher and create a lasting bond. Another aspect that connects both movies is that both Will and Matilda are brilliant as a result of reading hundreds of books.
It's easy to relate to how heartbroken Robin Williams is with his wife dying. I feel that by put his time into therapy he is able to escape his grief. I really enjoyed his eccentric storytelling of the day he met his wife. This scene added to how Robin Williams was able to balance his grief with remembering the joyous memories.
The shots and angles in this film were also well put together. During most of Will's therapy sessions the director uses eye level and medium shots. By using this effect the director is able to have the audience feel like they are in the room. Along with this the readers are forced to read the facial expressions to get a sense of emotion. During every therapy session but the last both Sean and Will are not in the same shot together. By creating this composition it creates the effect of a real conversation that goes back and forth. Another example of how the director used angles/shots was when he strategically used a high angle shot to show power and dominance. This scene occurred while Will burned the proofs and Professor (Stellan Skarsgard) was on his knees and the camera angle was above him. Will's power over his own life shows true here because of the element of a high shot.
The fight scene is a notable scene because of the sounds and music in the background. The music is very subtle, and there is multiple layers of other peoples voices, but overall the directors were able to edit it together to make it feel like the audience was in the right scene. and finally there is a cop car that skids to a start and arrests Matt Damon. The soundtrack for the remainder of the film is very well thought and adds to either the suspense, happiness of craziness going on in Matt Damon's life.
The script includes dialect that is noticeably a Boston accent. There was the use of wicked which is a famous Boston stereotype. The accents were also very strong on Matt Damon and his Southie friends like Ben Affleck. I think it was a wise decision to cast Matt Damon and Ben Affleck because of their natural Boston accents.
The ending to me was a bit predictable, in scenes earlier you were foreshadowed by what was ahead. Also in most movies there is a happy ending and this movie does just that. The director also left with a bit of a cliffhanger which in today's movies is expected to have the audience create their own ending.
By the end of the movie I felt attached to Will's character and Sean's grief, and the romance between Skylar and Will. Good Will Hunting was a classic movie that will be enjoyed by many in the coming years. I would definitely recommend putting in the time to watch and enjoy Good Will Hunting.

Starting slow but interesting, I found the story utterly absorbing and emotionally moving (which is, unfortunately, quite rare with me). For me it was one of those movies that you check your watch and pray it's not over yet -- it's not a story you watch to bring you from Point A to Point B -- it's the going that's good. It's a well-written, well-acted story with deep characters that you care about.Even the least-developed main relationship, Will and Skylar's, was profound. The torment that Will brought her in the end merely reflects his own, and you can feel that.I'd love to see a sequal (Better Will Hunting?) to see what they do with Will/Skylar. If it were true to life, it'd have her telling him to shove-off, but that'd make for a pretty short movie.

So I hear everyone talking about this great movie by two young up and coming actors looking for work and how awesome this movie is.  And so, I go and I see Good Will Hunting.  Now I know why Matt Damon was struggling to find work. I bought the screenplay and read it before I ever saw the movie and the screenplay itself is great.  I've read it many times since and each time, I still love it.  However, for some reason, the executives at Miramax failed to see that letting Damon and also Minnie Driver have roles in this movie would be a mistake.  Affleck is a good actor, although his part sucks in this movie but Damon went and wrote a whole story about his character and then failed to deliver. There were a few positives.  The friendship between Affleck and Damon does spill over into the movie and it does leave an impression.  Robin Williams is great.  I mean, the man can do anything. Comedy, drama, anything.  But the rest of the cast is pretty much mediocre except for Ben Affleck who also was good in Chasing Amy. In all, this movie was OK but nowhere near as good as the hype made it out to be.  The screenplay is definitely worth buying but the acting in the movie itself pretty much sucks.

After hearing people rant and rave about how terrific this movie was....some even saying when it came out in home video they were going to BUY a copy, not just rent it, I figured it had to be a terrific movie.  Boy, was I ever led down the garden path.  The only GOOD thing about it was familiar scenery in Boston.  The premise of a lowly janitor solving complex mathematical problems was a good one.  But once the viewer found that out, then what? Nothing happens at all....just a bunch of video filling, time wasting pablum puke.  The plot completely fell apart so that you are left with, "Okay, so the janitor is a genius, now what?  What does he do with this capability? Anything?  No....NOTHING!!!"  I want my $6.75 back PLUS damages!!!  What a total waste of two hours!!!

A streamlined, honest work of screenwriting art that Syd Field certainly approves of.  Without Van Sant's unflinching commitment, this film likely would not have even been made.  Screenwriters should buy this script and study it's structure.  There isn't a line  uttered throughout the entire film that we've heard before, except "I love you"(and if you are going to have a line we've heard in other films, that my friends, is the one you want it to be).

reviews.review_title: This movie is 10 time better than Titanic!!!!
reviews.content: I would just like to say that Matt Damon, Ben Affleck and Robin Williams kick some serious butt in this movie. I never get tired of watching it. The dialogue is so authentic and funny that you just can't help watching it more that one time. I can't wait until Matt and Ben write another movie so I can see that one.

I don't usually comment on movies, but I felt compelled to respond to some of these poor reviews. The justifications for giving Good Will Hunting a low mark seem (in general) barely thought out and petty. Someone's assertion that Affleck and Damon simply couldn't think of what to say so they kept using the "f word" stands out.  Go to this web site's Good Will Hunting memorable quote page.  There is a reason why it is one of the longest of any movie featured.Arguments that the individual story lines are unrelated and the ending is weak, lead me to believe you must have been trying to put moves on your date instead of watching the movie.  Instead, of giving us a hokey feel good ending, Affleck and Damon offer something much more insightful and honest. Will recognizes that he must deal with lingering emotional problems before he can be satisfied and successful in any profession. The ending is only a recognition of the problem, not a solution. So instead of neatly wrapped up closure, Good Will Hunting ends with something much closer to real life.
A very interesting movie. I enjoyed it. The plot was very predictable. The mathematical proofs looked kind of sketchy. And the depiction of MIT was just plain wrong.

Life is like a box of Chocolates! Robin, again phenomenal."O Captain! My Captain!"
1865 Walt Whitman

reviews.review_title: Exploring the mind of a traumatic genius
reviews.content:
This film is a tale of a genius with a traumatic childhood. Orphan Will Hunting has shifted from one foster home to another. Wherever he went he got nothing but abusive foster parents. He soon realises that he is a genius, but his defence mechanism won't allow him to make use of that so he takes up the job of a janitor in M.I.T . He hoped for an opportunity to showcase his brilliance and he got that when Professor Lambeau challenged students to sopve an open problem in mathematics. Will Hunting solved all of them anonymously. Eventually Lambeau found him out and offered him a job with him. But on a condition that he goes to therapy. Will laughs it off and says he doesn't need therapy. It is then we get to see Sean(Robin Williams). He started to break down the walls Will had built in his mind and we get to see the real Will. All his life Will has kept pushing people away, he has built walls around himself to show that nothing affects him anymore. All of these just to avoid the trauma that haunts him, to repeat itself. By the end of the film Sean is able to reach out to the real Will behind all those barriers and make him drop his act of "don't care about anything or anyone" .There are certain scenes in the film which has the word perfection written all over it. The scene by the lake, where Will realises for the first time that someone has caught his trick of pushing people away. "You don't know about real loss, 'cause it only occurs when you have loved something more than you love yourself".
This film is a beautifully written journey of a traumatic genius, towards breaking down his barriers and letting go of his paranoia. It provides an emotional journey for the audience into the mind of Will Hunting.
We learn one thing from the film that is to let ourselves know that "it's not your fault".

It's an excellent story with a great cast. Two very important messages for me. Firstly, Educational opportunities for people of all backgrounds and walks of life so People can live up to their potential and have opportunity to excel in their strengths. Secondly the importance of people getting support for past traumas that have impacted their life so they can cope and go on and live productive lives.

reviews.review_title: wish i saw this in theatres!
reviews.content: I love this movie beyond belief. I wish i could have seen this when it came out. Ben Affleck and Matt Damon did an excellent job at writing it and starring in it. A masterpiece. Tale of a prodigy math genius plagued by his past and his inability to connect to anyone close. The conflict with Matt Damon's character really keeps you engaged. I truly had feelings of hope, joy, and sadness. This movie is one of the ones you simply have to watch at least once. I give it a high review because it should maintain its superiority in today's dilute and mediocre film industry. Shining example of what true cinema can bring. Thank you Ben and Matt, Truly touched me in this tale.Ps. excellent movie for a date night ;)

reviews.review_title: Still on top of my list
reviews.content: I cant stop to wonder why it is that so many people like to relate a movie (meaning = entertainment) to real life. people, that is not what movies are for, those things are called Documentaries and the 8 o clock news. Movies are for entertainment, and so is Good Will hunting.It is meant to make you feel something, and fortunately for us, everybody feels different after seeing this movie, great! but to go as far as saying: its putting janitors in a bad daylight, and they didn't wrote the script, its not historically correct, etc, etc, and then giving this movie a 1 score, is saying more about you then this movie in itself.If you did not like this movie, because you have a different taste, or just did not liked the story, great, please do rate this movie low(er), but you cannot hide the feeling you got from this movie, be it goosebumps, anger, sleep or whatever. that is at least something. I have seen a lot of movies where I did not felt anything afterwards, now that means the movie was bad! Skylar and Will play great together. I can totally feel the fun the had in the beginning of their relationship. The tight friendship with his friends is totally heartwarming, and Robbin Williams really felt like a good, soft man to me.I smiled, swallowed, cried, laughed and busted my gut on this movie. sure, the story could be better, but the feeling i got from it not.I know the jokes inside out in this movie, and still, when I watch this movie, I laugh.. that alone is worth a 10 to me.

Congratulations to Ben Affleck and Matt Damon for this one. The story is just fantastic. The boy-genius who just wanted to be normal and didn´t want to get the opportunities because he was too afraid of the changes in his life and that he would lose control of the process. Actually, this film isn´t just about the charismatic character Will Hunting, it`s really about us. Maybe neither the director nor the writers wanted to tell this, but that`s just about it. In this lonely world we are afraid to open ourselves to the people around us because we fear they might hurt us. We want to be in control of our own world. Ok, this shields away most suffering, but it also blocks a great heap of happiness . Will has a hard time discovering his true potential and what his life can become. But, than again, so do we. Some people I met hated the film because he rejected great job opportunities and went after happiness. I think these people are afraid to pursue their dreams too. Never give up your dreams

reviews.review_title: One of the best movie I've ever seen
reviews.content: This movie touched my deeply. The acting was good and plot was also superb

reviews.review_title: The best Picture of all time!!
reviews.content: This is the story of an orphan who works as a janitor in one of Havard's prestigious colleges. He gets noticed by a Professor Lambo after resolving an important and difficult math problem.He's a genius! Pr Lambo asks him to help him out with some other math theories, but at the mean time, he's requested to see a shrink as he has anger management issues...This shrink (played wonderfully by Robin Williams)is his perfect match and will change the rest of his life...and vice-versa... This movie is one of the best i have ever seen. Humor, emotions...everything is in this movie! Bravo to Matt Damon and Ben Affleck for co-writing this fantastic movie!

Movies do not need special effects to captivate audiences. What good movies should need (like Good Will Hunting) is some astonishing dialouge and lines to keep people laughing and possibly even crying."Good Will Hunting" is a movie that makes you think. The characters are so real, that the movie does nothing but captivate the audience by the authenticity of the actors. Both Matt Damon and Ben Affleck (who also co-wrote the movie) share this unique bond that audience members admire.For those who havent seen this, I completely recommend it! It is a great film with spectacular dialogue, superb acting and above all- a geniune story guaranteed to touch the heart!

reviews.review_title: A movie about a troubled young man, his past, and his future.
reviews.content: This film follows the life of Will Hunting, a diamond-in-the rough genius who makes a living out of the small town Southie by working as a janitor at the prestigious MIT. After anonymously completing an equation that eventually underlines his genius, he is found out by the renown Fields medal winner Professor Lambeau. With his help, along with a psychiatrist named Sean Maguire, he learns to accept his past and move forward with his childhood problems, despite his greatest fears, witty quips, girl problems, and bad habits, that are all the more amplified by his genius and lack of willingness to take advantage of opportunities.
Great Screenplay by Matt Damon And Ben Affleck. Absolutely Loved it. Great Acting From All Th e Cast Members Especially From Robin Williams, Loved His Performance.

reviews.review_title: Matt & Ben should write more scripts!
reviews.content: I think it is safe to say that anyone who has seen this movie will wonder how two young actors managed to write such a beautiful and realistic story, with characters you can relate to despite the fact that one of them is an overlooked math genius. Add to that creditable performances from everyone involved (esp. Robin Williams in semi-dramatic mode), good directing and wonderful musical contribution from Elliott Smith (who was unfortunate not to win a Grammy for "Miss Misery"), and you have one of the most endearing movies ever. You can tell right away from the first scene that Matt Damon and Ben Affleck are the bestest of friends, and they have several poignant scenes in this movie. Minnie Driver was good as well, and you have to feel for her character. Well, like I said before...those two really should write more scripts, who knows what other stories are stored away in their heads. Watch this movie if you haven't already!

I watched this movie three times and increased my score on it every time, this movie is a classic and timeless. This movie will get better with time. The pacing and the dialect is what makes this movie. It keeps things simple from the storyline of a very complex characters. This will always be in my top 20(I watch Lott of movies) and I always find myself thinking of the dialect such as wills conversations at the bar. I feel that every one will enjoy this movie especially if you know nothing about it. It will keep your attention and the movie will not go a minute too long, I don't like romance movies and this movie accepted that fact for ppl like me.

reviews.review_title: Never get tired of a good story
reviews.content:
I never saw this movie in the cinema. I regret this. Many months later, after the hype subsided, I decided to rent the movie on video. What I watched was a thoroughly entertaining story!It's this kind of story that is simple enough to get enticed straight away and real enough that you don't lose interset half way through.
The real hook for Good Will Hunting, though, is Robin Williams performance. He was good in 'Awakenings' and even better in 'Dead Poets Society', but never better than here as the burnt out councillor who hasn't been challenged in years. He finally meets his match in Will Hunting (Matt Damon).There are many sub-plots in this story, but the ones that will make you sit up and take notice will be the exchanges between Will Hunting and Sean (Robin Williams).There are also many fine supporting performances, some of which have never been bettered in other movies. Stellan Skarsgard is convincing as the pretentious, insecure MIT professor. Ben Affleck also delivers his best performance to date as the ever loyal, Chuckie. Perhaps the only let down performance is by Minnie Driver.Overall, It's the kind of movie you can sit and watch time and time again and never get tired of.I rate it 10 out of 10.

This is one of the best films I've seen to date. I've watched it three times in a row and if I ever picked it off the shelf I'd watch it three times again. Very good with the best speeches ever, The cast is great, very funny -dont listen to stupid people's opions on it, they have no freedom of speach in my view. See it now!

reviews.review_title: It's an old movie, but it still got important things to tell
reviews.content: I watched this movie in my English class. It's a movie about a guy named Will, who is very aggressive and tries to play cool in front of his friends.He's also a math genie but doesn't do anything about his talent. Behind his facade there is something a little deeper about his behavior, something about a childhood that was ruined and about an insecure boy. He is about to go to jail, when a teacher saves him, and makes him go to therapy. This movie is all about a guy who has a hard time trusting people and letting them in, also about why people can be so aggressive sometimes and that it all can be a misunderstanding. I thought this movie was pretty good, because I can relate to Will and because the actors were great. Even tho the movie is about 17 years old it still focuses on important things that can happen to anyone. I thought this movie was good. There's a scene in the movie where Will and Skylar has a fight, I think that scene is important because it shows that Will is vulnerable and that he also got feelings.

Matt Damon says, to the Oscar reviews on this movie , that "the voters aren't always right", and he's so correct. This is so far the most soul-clutching movie I've ever seen. It's as simple as that.For people who never understand how emotionally bruised teens end up in various symptoms of depression, go watch this movie. WATCH CLOSELY.Watch and see for yourself, how pain builds over pain, and eventually bricks up a thick, cold, ugly wall that resists sunlight to come in. How he who with such a wall established inside "pushes people away before they have a chance to leave him", and that however much he may in a corner of his heart longs for genuine warmth or intimacy, he's just not able to open up and let them in. And, most importantly, watch for when the WALL is being melted down, how much emotion can explode from and flood out of that person and break you, the watcher, down into wild tears, if you are able to comprehend the amount of pain behind it.Matt Damon did it, with incredible accuracy. Point is when you approach such subject with emotionally bruised characters,even the slightest hint of inauthenticity could easily give you away----for the people who did experience it know exactly how it is. And any mishandling of such emotion, too far-pushed or too slow, will inevitably cause the audiences to resent----for they felt like being misexplored at their most painful spot.But he did so well. He causes you to resonate with your own bruises, face up to your own pain. No patronizing, no preaching, no trivializing. Every scar was revealed in an authentic, respectful, humane and serious kind of way that you end up in gratitude that the creator of this film truly cares----it's not just about a movie, it's about psychological wounds many share in common. It's about human, and humanity.I wonder how Matt Damon did it so well. I'd rather assume that he did, for himself once had a similar experience in life, than that he simply achieved this by outstanding acting skills. The latter would be nearly impossible to do, having known for myself what this type of pain was really like.Affleck and Damon are an unbelievable team, both in acting and writing this movie. Robin Williams sure as hell deserves the Oscar he got for his role here, and the rest of the cast all did a great job. The movie has a very smooth and well-structured storyline. No waste scenes, one step tightly after another, unfolding the character's emotion progresses. When you finally witness Williams's role gets to the soul of Damon's role with a number of "It's not your fault", your icy wall if you have one too, shattered with it.Most soulful movie I've ever seen.
